lines.text: You're fucking up my makeup!

[before stabbing Anne in the eye]
Don't look now!
I'm Baby Oopsy-Daisy, will you be my special friend?
What the hell?
I can walk, i can talk, i can even shit my pants.

[confused]
huh?
Can you shit your pants?
[repeated line]
Playtime!

[to Charnetski]
Hi ya fat fuck I'm Baby Oopsy Daisy you lardass!, will you be my special friend?
Mother of Satan! Could this be the end of Baby Oopsy Daisy?
[head blows up]

[dragging Charnetski's corpse down the stairs]
Geeze you're heavy you Moby fucking Dick!

[after being kicked in head by Mark]
Bummer!
Oh, God!
God has nothing to do with this, judith. Actually, let's scratch the word 'God' from our lexicon altogether. Let's talk demons instead.
Everything tastes like chicken, you notice that? Frog legs, snakes... even rabbits taste like chicken.
Everything except this shit.
Maybe I should just save him the trouble and kill myself.
Why don't you?
Shut the fuck up... I wasn't talkin' to you, motherfucker!
[fires shotgun]

[Playing game of cards]
I win.
I win.
War.

[to a dying Hesse]
We're gonna have a lot of fun here tonight, friend. We're gonna raise Hell...

[to a hysterical Judith]
Don't worry Judith, the pain won't last long. I'll speed up the birth. You can be the proud new mother of a brand new demon by sunrise.

[Screaming]
No!
Then blood's *really* gonna run...
Hello Judith, so glad you could make it. You know, it just wouldn't be a show without you.
Oh, god! Help me!
This isn't so bad, is it?
The world is a toilet, and everyone in it are assholes.
Mister wayne, is that a cigarette in your mouth?
No, it's your dick.
Hello, Judith.
Where are we?
Inside the doll's house. It's part of the astral plane. This is where I live. For now.
This isn't real, this isn't real!
It's real enough... I brought you here, so we could have a chat.
Who are you?
A spirit, just like your little friend said. A bad one, too.
You look like a little boy to me.
Oh? I can take any form I want to. I can be this...

We're not part of your physical world. We feed off your fear, your pain, your deaths. But that's not enough to satisfy me... You know what I really want, Judith? A body to hang my soul in. A real body. Blood, and bones.
What are you talking about?

Right now, I'm weak. My spirit is bound by the walls of this warehouse. It's taken all my strength, just to animate these toys. Even that took sixty six years of rest. Sixty six years, since the last time I tried to be born...
